column2: et ópera mánuum ejus adnúnțiat firmamèntum. ^ The heavens show forth the glory of God
column3: and the firmament declareth the work of his hands.

column2: et nòx nòcti ìndicat sciènțiam. ^ Day to day pouring forth speech
column3: and night to night showeth knowledge.
qŭórum non aŭdiántur voces eórum. ^ There are no speeches nor languages
column4: where their voices are not heard.

column1: 5 ^ In òmnem terram exívit sonus eórum
column2: et in fines orbis terraĕ vèrba eórum. ^ Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth
column3: and their words unto the ends of the world.

column2: et ìpse tamqŭam sponsus procédens de tálamo suo. Exsultávit ut ģigas ad currèndam viam. ^ He hath set his tabernacle in the sun
column3: and he as a bridegroom coming out of his bridechamber. He hath rejoiced as a giant which shall run the way.

column2: et occùrsus ejus usqŭe ad summum ejus
column3: nec est qŭi se abscòndat a calóre ejus. ^ His going out is from the end of heaven
column4: and his circuit even to the end thereof
column5: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat.

column1: 8 ^ Lex Dòmini immaculáta convèrtens ánimas~; testimónium Dòmini fidéle
column2: sapiènțiam praĕstans párvulîs. ^ The law of the Lord is unspotted
column3: converting souls~; the testimony of the Lord is faithful
illúminans òculos. ^ The justices of the Lord are right
column4: rejoicing hearts~; the commandment of the Lord is lightsome

column2: pèrmanens in sáĕculum sáĕculi~; judìcia Dòmini vera
column3: justificáta in semet ìpsa. ^ The fear of the Lord is holy
column4: enduring for ever and ever~; the judgments of the Lord are true

column1: 11 ^ Desiderabìlia super aŭrum et lápidem prețiósum mùltum
column2: et dulcióra super mel et favum. ^ More to be desired than gold and many precious stones
column3: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.

column1: 12 ^ Ètenim sèrvus tuus custódit ea~; in custodièndîs illîs retribúțio mùlta. ^ For thy servant keepeth them
column2: and in keeping them there is a great reward.

column1: 13 ^ ¿~Delìcta qŭìs intèlleģit~? Ab occùltîs meîs mùnda me
column2: ^ Who can understand transgression~? From my secret ones cleanse me

column1: 14 ^ et ab aliénîs parce servo tuo. Si mei non fúerint domináti
column3: et emundábor a delìcto maximo. ^ and from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me
column4: then shall I be without spot
column5: and I shall be cleansed from the greatest sin.

column1: 15 ^ Et èrunt ut compláceant elóqŭia oris mei
column2: et meditáțio cordis mei in conspèctu tuo sèmper. Dòmine adjútor meus
column3: et redèmptor meus. ^ And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please
column4: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord
